Class Deck

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.card.Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Represents a deck of adventure cards used in the gameModel. It manages different levels of cards, organizes them into decks, and provides methods for drawing and shuffling.

  • Constructor Details

    • Deck

      public Deck()

  • Method Details

    • setGameClientNotifier

      public void setGameClientNotifier(GameClientNotifier gameClientNotifier)

    • createGameDeck

      public void createGameDeck(boolean isTestFlight)
      Creates a game deck by combining specific card sets and shuffling them. Depending on the provided parameter, this method determines whether to include all cards or a subset of decks in the main game deck.
      Parameters:
      isTestFlight - A boolean value indicating whether all cards should be added to the game deck (true) or only specific "little" decks (false).

    • drawCard

      public AdventureCard drawCard(int inGamePlayers) throws EmptyStackException
      Draws a card from the game deck with specific rules based on game state and player count.

      First draw: Returns a level 2 card (level 1 in test mode) and sets it as START_CARD. Single player: Cannot draw WarField cards. Multiplayer: Draw any card from the deck.

      Parameters:
      inGamePlayers - The number of players in the game
      Returns:
      The drawn AdventureCard with a state set to START_CARD
      Throws:
      EmptyStackException - if the game deck is empty

    • setUpLittleDecks

      public void setUpLittleDecks(GameModel gameModel)
      Sets up the little decks for the given game model. This involves loading all adventure cards, organizing them based on their levels, shuffling, populating the visible and non-visible little decks, and notifying all clients of the current state of the little visible decks.
      Parameters:
      gameModel - The game model instance with which the little decks will be associated.

    • composeLittleDecks

      public void composeLittleDecks(List<AdventureCard> level1Cards, List<AdventureCard> level2Cards, List<AdventureCard> littleDeck)
      Composes a small deck with a predefined number of level 1 and level 2 cards.
      Parameters:
      level1Cards - The list of available level 1 cards.
      level2Cards - The list of available level 2 cards.
      littleDeck - The deck to be populated with the cards.

    • getAllCards

      public List<AdventureCard> getAllCards()
      Retrieves all the adventure cards available in the deck.
      Returns:
      a list containing all the AdventureCard objects in the deck.

    • isLittleDeckAvailable

      public boolean isLittleDeckAvailable(int littleDeckChoice)
      Checks if a specified little deck is available to use and marks it as unavailable if it is free. This method is thread-safe and ensures atomic updates to the little deck's availability state.
      Parameters:
      littleDeckChoice - The index (1-based) of the little deck to check for availability.
      Returns:
      true if the specified little deck is available and has been marked as unavailable, false otherwise.

    • releaseLittleDeck

      public void releaseLittleDeck(int littleDeckChoice)
      Marks the specified little deck as available for future use by updating its state in the list that tracks the availability of little decks.
      Parameters:
      littleDeckChoice - The index of the little deck to be marked as free. The index value should be greater than or equal to 1.

    • getLittleVisibleDecks

      public List<List<AdventureCard>> getLittleVisibleDecks()
      Retrieves the little visible decks, which consist of organized and accessible lists of adventure cards that are part of the game's current state. The little visible decks represent subsets of adventure cards that are intentionally visible to players within the game context.
      Returns:
      A list of lists containing adventure cards, where each inner list represents a specific subset of visible adventure cards in the game's little decks.

    • getLittleNotVisibleDeck

      public List<AdventureCard> getLittleNotVisibleDeck()
      Retrieves the "little" non-visible deck of adventure cards. This deck contains a subset of cards that are not currently visible in the playable game state.
      Returns:
      A list of AdventureCard objects representing the little non-visible deck.

    • getLittleVisibleDecksString

      public List<List<String>> getLittleVisibleDecksString()
      Retrieves the string representations of the little visible decks. This method returns a list of lists containing the string representation of cards in the little visible decks. The representation is pre-mapped to avoid transferring full card objects over the network.
      Returns:
      A list of lists of strings, where each inner list represents a deck.

    • skipToLastCard

      public void skipToLastCard()
      Skips all cards in the game deck except the last one. This method retains only the topmost card in the deck, removing all others.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game deck contains only one or no cards.

    • hasFinishedCards

      public boolean hasFinishedCards()
      Checks if the game deck is empty, indicating that all cards have been finished.
      Returns:
      true if the game deck is empty, false otherwise
